ovdesc.p: SC.SUB.ACC.ROUTING is an application that the user can use to set-up the routing instructions for the sub-accounts of a particular depository.
This application has the same way as the routing from depository to sub-depository in SC.DEPOT.ROUTING.
These sub-accounts must exist in SUB.ACCOUNT field of CUSTOMER.SECURITY file keyed on the depository.
The sub-account can't be removed from the CUSTOMER.SECURITY file if it always exists in SC.SUB.ACC.ROUTING application.
The routing on the-sub account is based on criteria that are :
- selections on customer which are defined by the fields on CUSTOMER file.
The sub-account is now an element of the key of SECURITY.POSITION, CAPTL.INCREASE.CUS, DIV.COUP.CUS, ENTITLEMENT, REDEMPTION.CUS, REPO.POSITION and STOCK.DIV.CUS files.

Local reference field
Identifies any additional element which has been defined locally to meet a particular requirement.

As in the majority of T24 Applications, the User is allowed to define in the SC.SUB.ACC.ROUTING file up to 999 Local elements in addition to the standard fields previously specified. These local elements should be defined by the User where deemed necessary according to local practice.

The name of the new element(s), as well as the Format and
Validation Rules:, must be defined in the LOCAL table (Ref: UTILITIES) and LOCAL.REFERENCE table (Ref: UTILITIES) prior to their use in the SC.SUB.ACC.ROUTING Application.

1-35 characters as defined in the LOCAL table (Ref: UTILITIES) definition for this local reference field. Multivalue field. (Optional or Mandatory input according to definition in LOCAL table (Ref: UTILITIES) for this Local Reference element.) As defined by the User within the individual LOCAL Table.
Three values are possible: blank, NEW and CHANGED.
This field is updated with NEW when the SC.SUB.ACC.ROUTING record is input and CHANGED when this record has been changed.
If the status is NEW or CHANGED then no sub account defaulting will take place.
The end of day routine SC.EOD.SUB.ACC.CHG clears this field to set-up the sub account of the depository according to the new rules defined on this record.
